item.description: This article captures cookbooks or recipes that I don't use frequently enough to remember, but still use it enough to be painful to google from scratch every time I use it. Its a bunch of totally unrelated stuff that is too short to put as a blog article on its …
item.dc:creator: Sharath Gururaj

item.title: The quest for high throughput RPC
item.description: In this post, I compare the rpc throughput of some existing RPC frameworks and talk about a new technique of doing RPC . Dropwizard on a single connection gives around 1000 req/sec, whereas a prototype implementation of this technique gives around 4 million req/sec for a “hello world” rpc …

item.title: A bangalore software engineer's first trip to Bali
item.description:
I have just returned from a 8 day trip to Bali. Here are some tips and info, fresh off my mind. These are points that I wish I knew before my trip to Bali, and the tips that I never came across online or on tripadvisor reviews.

item.description:

item.title: Setting up a ceph cluster
item.description:
The instructions here mostly work. Except that the ceph.conf file given there doesnt work. Because, when I issue sudo /etc/init.d/ceph start mon.node1 in the end, It expects a section in ceph. conf called [mon.node1]

Furthermore, to launch a radosgw instance, you need to have …

item.title: I finally setup a blog
item.description:
I finally setup my own blog! and i'm happy I did it the right way. No lame wordpress. I bought a virtual private server on digital ocean.

Virtual private server (or a droplet in digitalocean lingo) is a fancy name for your own computer in the cloud, which you can …
